docs.summary: Events that are fired by actions relating to site contacts.
description: Wix CRM events are fired on your site's backend when certain events occur related to site contacts.
You can write event handlers that react to these events. Event handler functions
receive data that corresponds to the event that fired. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to contact events.
To add a CRM event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your site if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles site visitor form submittal looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixCrm_onFormSubmit(event) { }
Note that backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a new workflow card is created.
description: The `onCardCreated()` event handler runs when a new [workflow](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-workflows)
card is created programmatically using the [`createCard()`](wix-crm-backend.Workflows.html#createCard)
function or manually in your site's Dashboard. The received `CardCreatedEvent`
object contains information about the card that was created.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a workflow card is moved.
description: The `onCardMoved()` event handler runs when a [workflow](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-workflows)
card is moved programmatically using the [`moveCard()`](wix-crm-backend.Workflows.html#moveCard)
function or manually in your site's Dashboard. The received `CardMovedEvent`
object contains information about the card that was moved.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a workflow card is moved.
description: The `onCardRestored()` event handler runs when a [workflow](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-workflows)
card is restored programmatically using the [`restoreCard()`](wix-crm-backend.Workflows.html#restoreCard)
function or manually in your site's Dashboard. The received `CardRestoredEvent`
object contains information about the card that was restored.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a site visitor submits a Wix Form.
description: The `onFormSubmit()` event handler runs when a site visitor submits a [Wix Form]($w.html#WixForms). The received `FormSubmitEvent`
object contains information about the Wix Form that was submitted.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An object representing a created card.
An object representing a moved card.

members.name: newPhaseId
members.doc: ID of the card's new phase.

members.name: newPhaseName
members.doc: Name of the card's new phase.

members.name: previousPhaseId
members.doc: ID of the card's old phase.

members.name: previousPhaseName
members.doc: Name of the card's old phase.

docs.summary: An object representing a moved card.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow the card was restored to.

members.name: workflowName
members.doc: Name of the workflow the card was restored to.

members.name: phaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase the card was restored to.

members.name: phaseName
members.doc: Name of the phase the card was restored to.

docs.summary: An object representing an attachment to a Wix Form.
An object representing a Wix Form field.
An object representing a Wix Form.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID of the site visitor submitting the Wix Form.

members.name: submissionTime
members.doc: Date and time that the Wix Form was submitted.

members.name: submissionData
members.doc: Data submitted in the Wix Form. The object contains key:value pairs where the key is the field name and the value is the contents of the field.
